intro: Triorchos, commonly known as the "false hellebore," is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a long taproot and can reach heights of up to 60 cm. However, it is toxic and should be handled with care.
